column1: mahiat-hasna-shawrna-7a1717226,Mahiat Hasna,Shawrna,"Architect, Urban Strategist, Placemaker and Capacity Developer",https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E03AQGXm8Yz8KYdCA/profile-displayphoto-shrink_800_800/0/1662469976410?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=8SlY0lhAHjoNajjryel6rlp3zxpQMELg5uEWwwAE6_Q,https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5616AQGSc-_i2yUcvg/profile-displaybackgroundimage-shrink_350_1400/0/1677243748725?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=POXoH7y0gyc0G0bRLC73aGlYthD5-bNPxCGRzSkm9Ws,personal,ACoAADiz-KkBsrYGTos8OAIEWaVUKGQuK7gcLt8,951318697,,"Mahiat is currently working as a transport coordinator in Bloomberg Philanthropies Initiatives for Global Road Safety (BIGRS) in Chattogram, Bangladesh. She has over 6 years of experience with different government organizations and an autonomous body where services like architecture, urban public space design, environmental conservation work, policy advocacy related to human settlement and land use planning, etc., were provided in developing Bangladesh. Mahiat holds a Master’s Degree in Urban Management and Development from IHS, Erasmus University of Rotterdam, Netherlands, in a specialized track called ‘Infrastructure and Green Cities’, and a Bachelor’s in Architecture from BRAC (the Bangladesh Rural Advancement Committee) University, Bangladesh.
* Building the Cycling City_ The Dutch Blueprint for Urban Vitality by Melissa Bruntlett & Chris Bruntlett
* Road to Nowhere by Paris Marx
* Punching Clouds_ Punching Clouds: An Introduction to the Complexity of Public Decision-Making by Lasse Gerrits
* The Power of a Positive Team_ Proven Principles and Practices that Make Great Teams Great by Jon Gordon

'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'Bloomberg Philanthropies Initiative for Global Road Safety (BIGRS)', 'description': '▪ Coordinate multiple partners’ safer streets and safer mobility work with national-level authorities by designing, planning and recommending to reduce road injuries and deaths.
▪ Conduct need assessment of national authorities, organize and provide capacity-building sessions and dissemination workshops for evidence informed decision making.
▪ Manage high amounts of inter-agency complexity at the national (city corporation, police, BRTA) and international levels (Vital Strategies, WRI, GRSP & John Hopkins University).
▪ Evaluate initiative progress and submit findings (including a review of monitoring data) to transportation officials at both BRTA & Chattogram City Corporation, also Vital Strategies & WRI.
▪ Provide recommendations for overcoming barriers to progress and for leveraging opportunities to rapid achievement of success', 'title': 'Transport Coordinator', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 74280132, 'name': 'Department Of Architecture, Ministry Of Housing & Public Works', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHwqH7-nCrIlQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1622303197381?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=7zg0DM2wGbljU8D0_c1pWUwrRLP42rxnQuaVUwfL-T0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/doa-gob/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Department Of Architecture, Ministry Of Housing & Public Works', 'description': '● Providing planning, designing & general architectural services (urban public spaces, residential, commercial, institutes etc.), site supervision and liaison with construction professionals by respecting Building codes, Detailed Area Plans and Environmental impacts.
